name: 'Ever After' Quotes Quiz Challenge - How Much Do You Know? |     Movies

questions.text: 'How can anyone love a pebble in their shoe?'
'All I ask, Your Majesties, is that you show her the same courtesy she has bestowed upon me.'
'She laughs at me, sir, as if she knows something I do not.'
'You look like a girl!'
'The woman had many secrets. I merely painted one of them.'
questions.explanation:
Da Vinci.

	Played by Patrick Godfrey.

questions.text: 'And while Cinderella and her prince did live happily ever after, the point, gentlemen, is that they lived.'
questions.explanation:
Grande Dame.

	Played by Jeanne Moreau.

questions.text: 'I shall never forget how Marguerite's feet went up over her head like that!'
'Think, Danielle. Think really hard.'
'I shall simply deny you the crown and... live forever!'
questions.explanation:
King Francis.

	Played by Timothy West.

questions.text: 'The only throne I want to see her on is the one I have to clean every day!'
'Why, that was pure genius!'
'I thought I was looking at your mother!'
'I may be twice your age, child, but I am well-endowed.'
'I was born to privilege and with that comes specific obligations.'
'Men are so fickle, aren't they? One minute they're spouting love sonnets, and the next you're back to being the hired help.'
'...and where in God's name is our bread?'
'Choose wisely, Henry. Divorce is only something they do in England.
questions.explanation:
Queen Marie.

	Played by Judy Parfitt.

questions.text: 'Me? Boil water? Oh, I knew it, I just knew it!'
'There was a bee.'
'I would rather die a thousand deaths than to see my mother's dress on that spoiled, selfish cow!'
'You cannot leave everything to fate, boy. She's got a lot to do. Sometimes you must give her a hand.'
'M'lady, you may have anything you can carry.'

'If you suffer your people to be uneducated and their manners corrupted from infancy, and then punish them for what their first education disposed them, what else is to be concluded, sir, but that you first make thieves and then punish them?'
'Well, Danielle, which shall it be? Your father's book or your mother's shoes? Neither will save you from a sound lashing.'
'Now, how what is that phrase you use again? Oh yes. Once upon a time...'
